IRONIC.Definition: strange or funny because it wasn't expected

THE DONE THING.Definition: the usual or acceptable thing to do

WANDER.Definition: walk slowly and without a particular purpose

HAGGIS.Definition: a Scottish dish made of sheep's internal organs, oats, and spices

BAGPIPES.Definition: a musical instrument played by blowing air into a bag and forcing it out through pipes

COAL.Definition: a hard, black mineral that is burned as fuel

COIN.Definition: a flat, round piece of metal used as money

SEEK COVER.Definition: try to find protection from something dangerous

STRAY.Definition: not in the right place, unexpected

APARTHEID.Definition: a system of racial separation that existed in South Africa until 1994

TANK.Definition: a large, powerful military vehicle with a thick metal body

PARAMEDICS.Definition: people who are trained to give emergency medical care

BALCONIES.Definition: platforms or walkways that project from the outside of a building

CLAMP DOWN ON.Definition: try to control it by using stricter rules or punishments

CUNNING.Definition: clever and able to trick people

SELL OFF.Definition: sell them, especially in a way that is considered to be unfair

BOURGEOISIE.Definition: the ruling upper class of a capitalist society

POKING FUN AT.Definition: making fun of them in a playful way

PRETENTIOUS.Definition: trying to impress people by pretending to be more important than they really were

WHOLESOME.Definition: good for your health and well-being

WHISKY-DOWNING.Definition: involving drinking a lot of whisky

UNSUSPECTING.Definition: not aware of something dangerous that is happening

CHIPPED.Definition: damaged by having a small piece broken off

AFRESH.Definition: in a new or different way

UNORTHODOX.Definition: unusual or different from what is usual or expected

PILES.Definition: a large number of things that are stacked together
